column4: how do I install an editor like bluefish on a GNU/Linux distro.
is there an rpm or deb on it how do I find out
ok what then
is EMACs not good for you?
anyways:   sudo apt-get install bluefish
always search the repos first
apt-get not on the machine
are you not running ubuntu? this is the ubuntu support room
im guessing you didn't install this os?
alright, so let me get this straight, you have an OS, but you don't know what it is
you want a program, but you don't know what package manager it uses
are you being serious?
all linux is GNU/Linux....
so now we have narrowed it down to around 100 distros
where did you get this computer?
with the given information, the best I can do is recommend you manually compile the source code
which package manager are you using?
nvm, I thought you were saying you figured out the package manager....
Thats the question which package manager can i use on RPM shows up but some one said that was a bad idea
its dependant on your distro
round and round. How do i find out what the distro is?
debian, ubuntu and derivitives use aptitude,  suse and derivitives use yast,  rhel and dervitives use yum,  and gentoo, bsd and dervities use portage and pkg
ask the person that installed it
sometimes uname -r will do it, not always
